1.text: My son, watch my words, and thou shalt hide my commands with thee.

2.text: Watch my commands, and live; and my law as the pupil of thine eyes.

3.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, and write them upon the tablet of thine heart.

4.text: Say to wisdom, Thou my sister; and thou shalt call knowledge to understanding:

5.text: To watch thyself from the strange woman, from the stranger making smooth her sayings.

6.text: For in the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice,

7.text: And I shall see among the simple, I shall perceive among the sons a youth wanting heart,

8.text: Passing in the street near her corner; and he will step the way of her house,

9.text: In the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night, in the thick darkness:

10.text: And behold, a woman to his meeting, the attire of a harlot, and hidden of heart.

11.text: She being noisy and perverse; her feet will not dwell in her house:

12.text: One time without, one time in the broad ways; and she will lie in wait near every corner.

13.text: She laid hold upon him and kissed to him; she strengthened her face, and she will say to him,

14.text: Sacrifices of peace upon me: today I repaid my vows.

15.text: For this, I shall come forth to thy meeting, to seek thy face, and I shall find thee.

16.text: With adornings I spread my bed, variegated with thread of Egypt.

17.text: I sprinkled my bed with myrrh and aloes and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, we will be satisfied with loves till the morning: we will rejoice ourselves with loves.

19.text: For the man not in the house, he went in a way far off.

20.text: He took a bundle of silver in his hand; he will come to his house the day of the full moon.

21.text: With much of her talking she caused him to turn aside; with the smoothness of her lips she will thrust him away.

22.text: He went after her suddenly as the ox will go to the slaughter, and as the fetter for the correction of the foolish.

23.text: Till an arrow shall cleave his liver; as a bird hastening to the snare, and not knowing that it is for his soul.

24.text: And now, ye sons, hear to me, and attend to the sayings of my mouth.

25.text: And thy heart shall not deviate to her ways; thou shalt not wander in her beaten paths.

26.text: For she cast down many wounded, and the strong all being slain by her.

27.text: Her house the ways to hades, going down to the chambers of death.
